sentences.english: During the busy harvest season, farmers get up at the crack of dawn and don't stop working until dusk.
sentences.chinese: 在農忙季節，農夫從破曉就開始起牀工作直到黃昏。

sentences.english: At this moment, to announce the end of busy periods.
sentences.chinese: 這一刻，宣告着農忙時期的結束。

sentences.english: During busy seasons they help with field work.
sentences.chinese: 農忙季節他們幫助幹農活。

sentences.english: Our business in the city is not good when it's busy seasons for farmers.
sentences.chinese: 農忙時進城的人不多生意比較清淡。

sentences.english: In the busy season the village looked deserted when all the peasants had gone to the fields.
sentences.chinese: 農忙季節，人都下地了，村子裏顯得空蕩蕩的。

sentences.english: Self-employed farmers work from 55 to 60 hours per week during the peak summer mouths.
sentences.chinese: 自耕農在夏天農忙季節每星期勞動55到60小時。

sentences.english: I may be able to get off after the busy farming season.
sentences.chinese: 農忙季節過後我也許能離開。

sentences.english: He had even been kept out of school during the busiest seasons.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至於在農忙的時候被阻止去上學。

sentences.english: They made a living in Shanghai during the slack seasons of farming and returned during the busy ones.
sentences.chinese: 他們多在農閒期奔赴上海謀生，又在農忙時返鄉務農。

definition: to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
a rich farmer/to stress the importance of agriculture (in ancient philosophy)
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
test planting/crop grown on a trial basis
Yunfu prefecture level city in Guangdong province 廣東省|广东省[Guang3 dong1 sheng3] in south China
Dacun township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
branch secretary/secretary of a branch of the Communist Party or the Communist Youth League/abbr. for 支部書記|支部书记
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
